verses.kjv: In that day the LORD with his sore and great and strong sword shall punish leviathan the piercing serpent, even leviathan that crooked serpent; and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.
verses.web: In that day, LORD with his hard and great and strong sword will punish leviathan, the fleeing serpent, and leviathan the twisted serpent; and he will kill the dragon that is in the sea.
verses.ct: On that day, the LORD will take up his fierce, great, and powerful sword to punish leviathan, the fleeing serpent — leviathan, the twisting serpent — and he will slay the dragon that lurks in the sea.

verses.kjv: In that day sing ye unto her, A vineyard of red wine.
verses.web: In that day, sing to her, “A pleasant vineyard!
verses.ct: On that day, sing about her: "A beautiful vineyard!

verses.kjv: I the LORD do keep it; I will water it every moment: lest any hurt it, I will keep it night and day.
verses.web: I, LORD, am its keeper. I will water it every moment. Lest anyone damage it, I will keep it night and day.
verses.ct: I, the LORD, am its keeper. I water it constantly. Night and day I guard it so that no one can harm it.

verses.kjv: Fury is not in me: who would set the briers and thorns against me in battle? I would go through them, I would burn them together.
verses.web: Wrath is not in me, but if I should find briers and thorns, I would do battle! I would march on them and I would burn them together.
verses.ct: I hold no anger against it. But if briers and thorns rise up against me, I will march against them and burn them all together.

verses.kjv: Or let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me; and he shall make peace with me.
verses.web: Or else let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me. Let him make peace with me.”
verses.ct: Or else let them come to me for protection and make peace with me. Yes, let them make peace with me."

verses.kjv: He shall cause them that come of Jacob to take root: Israel shall blossom and bud, and fill the face of the world with fruit.
verses.web: In days to come, Jacob will take root. Israel will blossom and bud. They will fill the surface of the world with fruit.
verses.ct: In the days ahead, Jacob will take root. Israel will blossom and bloom, and its fruit will fill the whole earth.

verses.kjv: Hath he smitten him, as he smote those that smote him? or is he slain according to the slaughter of them that are slain by him?
verses.web: Has he struck them as he struck those who struck them? Or are they killed like those who killed them were killed?
verses.ct: Has the LORD struck Israel as hard as he struck those who attacked her? Has she been killed the way her enemies were killed?

verses.kjv: In measure, when it shooteth forth, thou wilt debate with it: he stayeth his rough wind in the day of the east wind.
verses.web: In measure, when you send them away, you contend with them. He has removed them with his rough blast in the day of the east wind.
verses.ct: He disciplined her with measured punishment, sending her away. He drove her out with a blast as harsh as an east wind.

verses.kjv: By this therefore shall the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this is all the fruit to take away his sin; when he maketh all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in sunder, the groves and images shall not stand up.
verses.web: Therefore by this the iniquity of Jacob will be forgiven, and this is all the fruit of taking away his sin: that he makes all the stones of the altar as chalk stones that are beaten in pieces, so that the Asherah poles and the incense altars shall rise no more.
verses.ct: This is how Jacob's sin will be forgiven — this is the full result of removing his guilt: when he crushes every altar stone to chalk dust, so that no Asherah pole or incense altar remains standing.

verses.kjv: Yet the defenced city shall be desolate, and the habitation forsaken, and left like a wilderness: there shall the calf feed, and there shall he lie down, and consume the branches thereof.
verses.web: For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation deserted and forsaken, like the wilderness. The calf will feed there, and there he will lie down, and consume its branches.
verses.ct: The fortified city stands empty, its homes abandoned and deserted like a wilderness. Calves graze there, lying down among the ruins and stripping the branches bare.

verses.kjv: When the boughs thereof are withered, they shall be broken off: the women come, and set them on fire: for it is a people of no understanding: therefore he that made them will not have mercy on them, and he that formed them will shew them no favour.
verses.web: When its boughs are withered, they will be broken off. The women will come and set them on fire, for they are a people of no understanding. Therefore he who made them will not have compassion on them, and he who formed them will show them no favor.
verses.ct: When the branches dry out, they snap off, and women come to gather them for firewood. These are a people with no understanding, so the one who made them will show them no mercy, and the one who formed them will give them no favor.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the LORD shall beat off from the channel of the river unto the stream of Egypt, and ye shall be gathered one by one, O ye children of Israel.
verses.web: It will happen in that day that LORD will thresh from the flowing stream of the Euphrates to the brook of Egypt; and you will be gathered one by one, children of Israel.
verses.ct: On that day, the LORD will thresh the grain from the Euphrates River all the way to the brook of Egypt, and you, people of Israel, will be gathered up one by one.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the great trumpet shall be blown, and they shall come which were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and the outcasts in the land of Egypt, and shall worship the LORD in the holy mount at Jerusalem.
verses.web: It will happen in that day that a great trumpet will be blown; and those who were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and those who were outcasts in the land of Egypt, shall come; and they will worship LORD in the holy mountain at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: On that day, a great trumpet will sound. Those who were dying in the land of Assyria and those who were scattered as outcasts in Egypt will come home and worship the LORD on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.
